description: [Status: stable] [Name: reimplemented-container-builtin] [Message: Prefer {container} over useless lambda] What it does Checks for lambdas that can be replaced with the list or dict builtins. Why is this bad? Using container builtins are more succinct and idiomatic than wrapping the literal in a lambda. Example from dataclasses import dataclass, field @dataclass class Foo: bar: list[int] = field(default_factory=lambda: []) Use instead: from dataclasses import dataclass, field @dataclass class Foo: bar: list[int] = field(default_factory=list) baz: dict[str, int] = field(default_factory=dict)
